{{infobox character | name=Great Eagle | people=[[Eagles|Eagle]] | image=Darrell Sweet - The Lord of the Eagles.jpg | caption="The Lord of the Eagles" by [[Darrell Sweet]] | pronun= | othernames=Eagle of the [[Misty Mountains]]{{H|18}} | titles=King of All Birds
[[Lord of the Eagles]] | position= | location=[[Great Shelf]] | affiliation=[[Manwë]] | language=[[Westron]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor=saving [[Thorin and Company]] | house= | family= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= | audio= | audiocaption= | timeline= | gallery=the Great Eagle }} The '''Great Eagle''' was the '''[[Lord of the Eagles]]''' of [[Middle-earth]] in the [[Third Age]].{{H|6}} ==History== In the [[Third Age]], the Great Eagle resided with fifteen chieftains at the [[Great Shelf]] on the east side of the [[Misty Mountains]]. At some point in his life, he was wounded by an arrow, but survived after the [[Wizards|wizard]] [[Gandalf]] healed his arrow-wound. Thenceforth, the Great Eagle held Gandalf in friendship. During the [[Quest of Erebor]] in {{TA|2941}}, the Great Eagle and many of his servants saved [[Thorin and Company]] from [[Orcs]] and [[Wargs]] and brought them to the Eyrie, where they spent the night. Later that year, the Eagles appeared many hours into the [[Battle of Five Armies]] by the [[Lonely Mountain]], and were crucial in the victory over the Orcs and Wargs.{{H|17}} After the battle, the Great Eagle was proclaimed '''King of All Birds''', and was given a golden crown while his fifteen chieftains were each given golden collars.{{H|Queer}} ==Other versions of the legendarium== In an early draft of the chapter "[[Out of the Frying-Pan into the Fire]]", the Great Eagle is referred to as "the '''lord of eagles'''" and "the '''[[Lord of Eagles]]'''" while his arrow-wound is stated to have come from a goblin's arrow.{{HH|VI}} In an early draft of the chapter "[[Queer Lodgings]]", the Great Eagle's title was changed to the [[Lord of the Eagles]] and he was given the title '''king of all Birds'''.{{HH|VII}} ==Portrayal in adaptations== ===The Great Eagle in adaptations=== File:The Hobbit (1977 film) - Lord of the Eagles.png|[[The Hobbit (1977 film)|''The Hobbit'' (1977 film)]] '''1980: ''[[Der Hobbit (1980 German radio series)|''Der Hobbit'' (1980 German radio series)]]'':''' : In the [[1980]] German radio series adaptation, Friedrich W. Bauschulle voiced the Lord of the Eagles. ==Speculation== It is often thought that the Great Eagle is the same individual as [[Gwaihir]], however it is more than likely that they are not the same one. Among several points which separate the two, the Great Eagle is mentioned to wear a crown after ''[[The Hobbit]]'' but no crown is mentioned with Gwaihir in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. Furthermore, Gandalf states that he was carried by Gwaihir three times, including following the [[Battle of the Morannon]],{{RK|VI4}} whereas the number would be at least five if Gwaihir and the Lord of the Eagles were one and the same. It is also possible that the Great Eagle was [[Thorondor]],[https://www.reddit.com/r/tolkienfans/comments/z1rtab/the_real_lord_of_the_eagles/ The real Lord of the Eagles] on reddit.com who also bore the title [[Lord of the Eagles]]. {{References}} {{Eagles}} [[Category:Characters in The Hobbit]] [[Category:Eagles]] [[Category:Rulers in Middle-earth]] [[Category:Third Age characters]]
